metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12900 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
BZ2_decompress in decompress.c in bzip2 through 1.0.6 has an out-of-boundswrite when there are many selectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bzip2 - 1.0.6-8ubuntu0.2
libbz2-1.0 - 1.0.6-8ubuntu0.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

clamav - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-base - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
clamdscan - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libclamav9 - 0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: bzip2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.6-8ubuntu0.2').
clamav package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.101.4+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
